Breaking news

Sky News: Cameraman killed in Egypt violence 9:10 AM

UPS cargo jet crashes in Ala.

A UPS A300 cargo plane en route from Louisville, Ky. crashed early this morning near an airport in Birmingham, Ala., an FAA spokeswoman said. A UPS spokesman said two crew members were aboard. (8:13 a.m.)

Egypt officials: 56 people dead in clashes

The Egyptian Health Ministry said 56 people have been killed and 526 were injured in clashes between police and pro-Morsi protesters. (8:30 a.m.)

Boston.com
10

Google: Don't expect GMail privacy

In a recent court filing, Google admitted what privacy researchers have warned for years: Users of the service have "no expectation of privacy," likening itself to a secretary who screens a boss's snail mail.
  • Pictures How to maintain your privacy online

Calif. teen: Captor deserved to die

The 16 year old, kidnapped by a close family friend, says the man got what he deserved when he died in a shootout with authorities in Idaho.

Film flops after boffo tax credit

"RIPD" cost an estimated $130 million to make, but grossed just $12.7 million, or less than half the value of its tax credit, during its opening weekend.

Are antibiotics coming to Chipotle?

Chipotle Mexican Grill said it’s considering tweaking its ‘‘responsibly raised’’ meat standards to allow meat from animals that have been given antibiotics to treat illnesses.
